4141     <h2 class="heading-medium">1. Overview</h2>
42      <p>You can apply for an Access to Work grant if you have a disability or health condition that makes it difficult for you to work.</p>
43      <p>The grant can be used to pay for <a href="intro3">special equipment or personal support</a> to help you: </p>
42      <p>You can apply for an Access to Work grant if you have a disability or health condition that causes you difficulty doing your job.</p>
43      <p>The grant can be used to pay for <a href="intro3">special equipment or support</a> to help you: </p>
4444     <ul class="list-bullet">
45        <li>start a new job</li>
46        <li>stay in work</li>
45        <li>do work tasks, either in your current job or for a new role</li>
4746       <li>get to and from work</li>
4847     </ul>
49      <p>You can't get a grant for business start-up costs.</p>
48    <p>It can also be used to help you in a job interview if you have communication difficulties.</p>
49      <p>You can't get a grant to help with business start-up costs.</p>
5050     <p>The grant doesn’t have to be paid back and won't affect any other benefits you get.</p>
5151 </div>

4747   <h2 class="heading-medium">Your condition</h2>
4848   <p>Your disability or health condition must affect your ability to do a job or mean you have to pay work-related costs. For example, if you need to buy computer equipment or have to take taxis because you can’t use public transport.</p>

5959   <h2 class="heading-medium">Changing jobs</h2>
60    <p>You may be able to take any special equipment that's been paid for with an Access to Work Grant with you if you change jobs. If you get regular grants (eg for travel to work) you'll have to apply for a new grant.</p>

4040     <p>How much you'll be offered depends on your condition and how much help you need.</p>
41      <p>The grant can pay for things like:</p>
41      <p>A grant can pay for things like:</p>
4242   <ul class="list-bullet">
43          <li>adaptations to equipment you have to use in your job</li>
44          <li>special equipment</li>
45          <li>travel costs to work if you can't use public transport</li>
43          <li>changes to equipment you have to use for your job</li>
44          <li>new special equipment, eg furniture or computer software</li>
45          <li>travel costs to and from work</li>
4646         <li>someone to help you in your workplace, eg a support worker</li>
47          <li>a support service, if you have a mental health condition</li>
47          <li>a support service</li>
4848         <li>disability awareness training for your colleagues</li>

5050         <li>moving special equipment if you change your job</li>
5151     </ul>
5252     <h2 class="heading-medium">Changes to Access to Work</h2>
53      <p>From 1 October 2015 the maximum grant that you could be offered will be £40,800.</p>
54    <p>If you have a grant before 1 October 2015 that's worth more than £40,800 it will be reduced in April 2018.</p>
53      <p>From 1 October 2015 the maximum grant that you could be offered will be £40,800 per year.</p>
54    <p>If you already have a grant or are given one before 1 October 2015 that's worth more than £40,800 it'll be reduced in April 2018.</p>
